Standard_Text: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise actions, emotions, or states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular topic (e.g., wildlife, conservation, and endangered when discussing animal preservation).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases and to identify alternate word choices in all content areas.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small-group discussion).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Choose punctuation for effect.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Choose words and phrases to convey ideas precisely.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction in a compound sentence.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use correct capitalization.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write fluidly and legibly in cursive or joined italics.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to, too, two; there, their).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Form and use prepositional phrases.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Order adjectives within sentences according to conventional patterns (e.g., a small red bag rather than a red small bag).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Form and use the progressive (e.g., I was walking; I am walking; I will be walking) verb tenses.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use interrogative, relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that) and relative adverbs (where, when, why).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Language Standards
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small-group discussion); use formal English when appropriate to task and situation.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Add audio recordings and visual displays to presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Plan and deliver a narrative presentation that: relates ideas, observations, or recollections; provides a clear context; and includes clear insight into why the event or experience is memorable.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized manner, using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker or media source provides to support particular points.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up on information, and make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the remarks of others.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 4 topics and texts, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Comprehension and Collaboration
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Speaking and Listening Standards
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Comprehension and Collaboration
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., "Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text").
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a character's thoughts, words, or actions].").
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; take notes, paraphrase, and categorize information, and provide a list of sources.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Produce clear and coherent writing (including multiple-paragraph texts) in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Orient the reader by establishing a situationand introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Link opinion and reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Provide reasons that are supported by facts and details.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the writer's purpose.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Writing Standards
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read on-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Fluency
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context and out of context.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Phonics and Word Recognition
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Reading Standards: Foundational Skills
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: By the end of year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grades 4—5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus and the information provided.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in a text or part of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area. (See grade 4 Language standards 4–6 for additional expectations.)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is supported by key details; summarize the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Key Ideas and Details
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Reading Standards for Informational Text
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in the grades 4—5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from different cultures.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: (Not applicable to literature)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each version reflects specific descriptions and directions in the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose, and refer to the structural elements of poems (e.g., verse, rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters, settings, descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking about a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including those that allude to significant characters found in mythology (e.g., Herculean). (See grade 4 Language standards 4–6 for additional expectations.)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character's thoughts, words, or actions).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text; summarize the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Key Ideas and Details
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Reading Standards for Literature
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Key Ideas and Details
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)
